newsitem.title: USA: NY/NJ Port Authority approves new projects.
newsitem.headline: NY/NJ Port Authority approves new projects.

text.p: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey Thursday approved a series of capital projects, including a runway extension at Newark Interntional Airport and a parking garage at Kennedy International Airport.
The Newark project will cost $93 million and add a total of 2,800 feet to the runway.
The board also authorized a $46 million 1,400 space parking garage at JFK which is expected to be completed in 1998, coinciding with the opening of Terminal 1.

Also approved was a $24.3 million project to equip the George Washington Bridge between New York City and New Jersey with an array of technologies designed to provide drivers with real-time information about conditions on the bridge.
